content:
• Friday, January 20, 2012
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CTIC) finishes the day up nearly 15% after saying earlier this morning...

    Cell Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CTIC) finishes the day up nearly 15% after saying earlier this morning that it's expecting the European Medicines Agency's Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use (OTC:CHMP) to release its opinion on the company's Marketing Authorization Application for Pixuvri in mid-February.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • SWKS

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS) finishes the day up 11.2% after the company beat on FQ1 earnings...

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS) finishes the day up 11.2% after the company beat on FQ1 earnings yesterday. Revenue was up 17% Y/Y, driven by growth in its adjacent analog semiconductor markets, global demand for mobile Internet applications and strong operational execution.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • HTLD

    Trucker Heartland Express (HTLD +1.9%) finished the day higher after its Q4 earnings missed on...

    Trucker Heartland Express (HTLD +1.9%) finished the day higher after its Q4 earnings missed on revenue but beat on a per share basis. Revenue rose 11% Y/Y as margins improved, though fuel costs continued to rise. In the latest period, fuel expenses rose 15%, primarily due to a 23% rise in average fuel prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • IMMU

    Immunomedics (IMMU -2.2%) finishes the day lower, despite reporting favorable results from the...

    Immunomedics (IMMU -2.2%) finishes the day lower, despite reporting favorable results from the study of its proprietary humanized antibody, clivatuzumab tetraxetan, as a treatment for patients with advanced, inoperable, pancreatic cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • VIAV

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU +3.8%) is lifted to Buy from Hold with a $17 target price at Stifel Nicolaus,...

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU +3.8%) is lifted to Buy from Hold with a $17 target price at Stifel Nicolaus, which notes that the broadband product maker's portfolio "remains poised to outperform the broader global economy" over the next few years with sales growth and margin comparisons easing throughout 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • ZOLL

    SunTrust Robinson Humphrey rings in on Zoll Medical (ZOLL +5.5%) after its solid FQ1 result late...

    SunTrust Robinson Humphrey rings in on Zoll Medical (ZOLL +5.5%) after its solid FQ1 result late yesterday, calling it a "phenomenal margin expansion story" and naming it as its top pick in the medical devices space. The firm expects its emerging businesses to rack up 30-40% growth over the next few years.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • ZIOP

    Biopharmaceutical company Ziopharm Oncology (ZIOP -5.5%) says it plans to sell an undisclosed...

    Biopharmaceutical company Ziopharm Oncology (ZIOP -5.5%) says it plans to sell an undisclosed number of shares of common stock to fund the development of its drug candidates, as well as for general corporate and working capital purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • SSD

    Simpson Manufacturing (SSD -4.4%) trades lower after Baird cut the shares to Underperform from...

    Simpson Manufacturing (SSD -4.4%) trades lower after Baird cut the shares to Underperform from Neutral on valuation, saying the risk/reward for the shares is leaning towards the downside.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • KVPBQ

    Shares of K-V Pharmaceutcial (KV.A +10.4%) rally as rival Columbia Laboratories (CBRX) gets...

    Shares of K-V Pharmaceutcial (KV.A +10.4%) rally as rival Columbia Laboratories (CBRX) gets raked over the coals by the FDA in a review of its preterm birth gel that ends up concluding the firm's data isn't sufficient. (previous: I, II). Trading on CBRX still halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • ANF

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -5.2%) dips on cautious comments out of Janney Montgomery this...

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -5.2%) dips on cautious comments out of Janney Montgomery this morning. The firm says it's worried about margin pressures due to excessive markdowns on winter merchandise in some of its flagship stores.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • INTC

    Intel (INTC +2.5%) continues to march higher after beating Q4 estimates, but the biggest...

    Intel (INTC +2.5%) continues to march higher after beating Q4 estimates, but the biggest surprise was the forecast for 2012 revenue to rise by mid- to high single digits vs. ~3% Street consensus. Wells Fargo finds the upbeat outlook "reassuring in the near term with exciting and very positive longer term implications,” while Raymond James calls it "needlessly aggressive."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • GOLD

    Barrick Gold (ABX -2.2%) sells off after guiding for its 2012 gold production to decline...

    Barrick Gold (ABX -2.2%) sells off after guiding for its 2012 gold production to decline slightly from 2011 levels. Moreover, the world's largest gold miner expects its cash production costs for gold to rise 15% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • HD

    A slightly worse-than-expected report on home sales pushes shares of home improvement giants...

    A slightly worse-than-expected report on home sales pushes shares of home improvement giants Home Depot (HD -2.2%) and Lowe's (LOW -2.5%) lower, while materials seller USG takes the news even worse - shedding 6.2% off its share price.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM | 4 Comments
  • PNCLQ

    Shares of Pinnacle Airlines (PNCL -5.7%) take an immediate tumble after a dire-sounding letter...

    Shares of Pinnacle Airlines (PNCL -5.7%) take an immediate tumble after a dire-sounding letter from CEO Sean Menke to employees is leaked to Bloomberg News. "On the current path, our financial position will continue to worsen at an alarming rate; we need to act immediately."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM

  • Shares of thinly-traded North Springs Resources (NSRS -17.1%) fall apart after the firm...

    Shares of thinly-traded North Springs Resources (NSRS -17.1%) fall apart after the firm announces that it expanded its credit facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • SON

    Sonoco Products (SON -5.1%) drops after saying its Q4 and FY11 profit will likely miss...

    Sonoco Products (SON -5.1%) drops after saying its Q4 and FY11 profit will likely miss estimates, due in part to higher taxes. For Q4, the company now expects earnings of $0.45 - $0.47 per share, below previous estimates of $0.59 - $0.63. For the full year, the company sees $2.28 - $2.30, below its prior guidance for earnings of $2.41 to $2.46.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -2.6%) gives back some of its recent gains following a critical note from Caris'...

    Netflix (NFLX -2.6%) gives back some of its recent gains following a critical note from Caris' David Miller. Miller thinks Netflix will guide for operating losses for at least the next 2 quarters during Wednesday's Q4 report, and remains concerned about the potential for higher licensing payments to EPIX. However, B. Riley's Eric Wold is lifting his PT to $125 on hopes of better-than-expected domestic subscriber growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • VOC

    VOC Energy Trust (VOC -11.5%) falls following a disappointing Q4 report and a couple of...

    VOC Energy Trust (VOC -11.5%) falls following a disappointing Q4 report and a couple of downgrades by Raymond James and Baird, citing the company's distribution problems and delayed drilling schedule.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • IBM

    IBM (IBM +4.2%) is rallying post-earnings, as its EPS beat and solid guidance calm investors...

    IBM (IBM +4.2%) is rallying post-earnings, as its EPS beat and solid guidance calm investors made nervous by the soft results (I, II) posted by services giants ACN and INFY. Though services revenue growth fell to 3% Y/Y, restructuring efforts contributed to a 17% increase in operating profit. Goldman (Buy) expects services and software profit growth to offset server/mainframe weakness in 2012. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • CMA

    Comerica (CMA +3.4%) moves up after Q4 earnings beat estimates, as an improvement in its overall...

    Comerica (CMA +3.4%) moves up after Q4 earnings beat estimates, as an improvement in its overall loan portfolio offset flat Y/Y earnings due to merger-related charges.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • CCL

    Carnival (CCL -1.9%) opens a "comprehensive audit and review" of its safety and emergency...

    Carnival (CCL -1.9%) opens a "comprehensive audit and review" of its safety and emergency response procedures in the wake of last week's fatal Costa Concordia wreck. CCL notes it and the cruise industry have an "excellent" safety record but CEO Mickey Arison says "this tragedy has called into question" the company's safety and response procedures and practices.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • MRK

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST -2%) dips after its Q3 misses estimates. Profit slid 53% Y/Y,...

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST -2%) dips after its Q3 misses estimates. Profit slid 53% Y/Y, largely due to acquisition-related costs resulting from its $190M deal for constipation drug-maker Adolor last month.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • WLL

    Whiting Petroleum (WLL -7%) tumbles after slashing its Q4 production estimate on account of the...

    Whiting Petroleum (WLL -7%) tumbles after slashing its Q4 production estimate on account of the later-than-expected arrival of service rigs at a North Dakota oil field. Whiting is also guiding for 2012 oil production growth of 13%-19%, and setting a 2012 capex budget of $1.6B.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • CWTR

    Shares of Coldwater Creek (CWTR +3.1%) catch a speculative wave after a story breaks tipping off...

    Shares of Coldwater Creek (CWTR +3.1%) catch a speculative wave after a story breaks tipping off that rival Talbots is in play.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • TLB

    Talbots (TLB +13.4%) surges after CNBC reports P-E firms Golden Gate Capital and TPG Capital...

    Talbots (TLB +13.4%) surges after CNBC reports P-E firms Golden Gate Capital and TPG Capital have submitted winning bids for the struggling apparel retailer.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • SYUT

    Synutra (SYUT +2.7%), which was crushed last week after the death of a child who consumed its...

    Synutra (SYUT +2.7%), which was crushed last week after the death of a child who consumed its infant formula triggered an investigation, is rebounding a bit after stating government tests conducted on formula purchased by the child's family found it to be compliant with regulations. Synutra is also reiterating its December quarter sales forecast of $90M-$93M, though that range is below a $93.8M consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • JCI

    Johnson Controls (JCI -3.3%) trades lower after missing FQ1 estimates and lowering FY12 guidance...

    Johnson Controls (JCI -3.3%) trades lower after missing FQ1 estimates and lowering FY12 guidance yesterday. JP Morgan and Needham both downgrade the shares on the back of the report, citing the company's reduced earnings visibility, softening markets and the potential for additional cuts in guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • LULU

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU -1.2%) tilt lower after comments made by an exec at the CIBC Whistler...

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU -1.2%) tilt lower after comments made by an exec at the CIBC Whistler Investor Conference on the firm's 2012 outlook disappoints investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • WMT

    Technicians may take notice of Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT), hitting a 52-week high of $61.23 and...

    Technicians may take notice of Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT), hitting a 52-week high of $61.23 and threatening to break out of a 10-year trading range. The shares hit just north of $62 right before Lehman in 2008, and a 10-year high of $63.75 in March 2002. After that, it's the all-time high of $67.37 on Christmas Eve 1999. (see also)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • HUM

    Humana (HUM -3.8%) is lowered at Wells Fargo on a more cautious outlook on Medicare Advantage, a...

    Humana (HUM -3.8%) is lowered at Wells Fargo on a more cautious outlook on Medicare Advantage, a different view from other recent analysis. While the program can still grow based on aging baby boomers and relative under-penetration of the market, Wells is concerned that "negative events are lurking on the horizon in the near term, which could weigh on the shares."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Around and around they go: Shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD) now trade 13.3% higher on nothing...

    Around and around they go: Shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD) now trade 13.3% higher on nothing more than flimsy talk that Eddie Lampert will go private with the company. Could it be a revenge play on the short-sellers who have bombarded shares of SHLD that is behind the chatter?

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 19 Comments
  • STI

    SunTrust's Q4 (STI +5%) Q4 profit was held down by $636M in mortgage repurchase demands, a 45%...

    SunTrust's Q4 (STI +5%) Q4 profit was held down by $636M in mortgage repurchase demands, a 45% jump Q/Q, and the bank confirms it is involved in AG settlement talks but doesn't book a charge. Sanford Bernstein analysts say the repurchase losses were higher than expected, but believe they are "manageable" and call the underlying results "solid."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • CTB

    Cooper Tire and Rubber (CTB +4.4%) trades higher after the company announces that it reached a...

    Cooper Tire and Rubber (CTB +4.4%) trades higher after the company announces that it reached a 4-year agreement with union workers for a new contract shortly before the expiration of a previous one.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • CCOI

    Shares of Cogent Communications (CCOI -15.5%) implode as the firm gets embroiled in the federal...

    Shares of Cogent Communications (CCOI -15.5%) implode as the firm gets embroiled in the federal indictment that took down Megaupload.com yesterday. The company maintains the servers that were allegedly involved in the illegal file sharing.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • SQNM

    Sequenom (SQNM -3.5%) bounces back a bit after being down over 8% just prior to the opening...

    Sequenom (SQNM -3.5%) bounces back a bit after being down over 8% just prior to the opening bell, in reaction to the company's pricing of its 13M share offering at $4.15 - a 10% discount to yesterday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • GOOG

    Goldman and Baird join Jefferies in defending Google (GOOG -7.9%) following its Q4 miss (I, II);...

    Goldman and Baird join Jefferies in defending Google (GOOG -7.9%) following its Q4 miss (I, II); each notes the role forex issues (i.e. a weak euro) had on results, and Baird also points out Google's display and mobile businesses are outperforming. However, BGC is downgrading shares to Hold, believing they'll be range-bound until the summer while the company digests the MMI acquisition. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 5 Comments
  • THS

    TreeHouse Foods (THS -12.7%) dives after warning soft December sales will lead it to post Q4 EPS...

    TreeHouse Foods (THS -12.7%) dives after warning soft December sales will lead it to post Q4 EPS in the range of $0.84-$0.87, below a $1.07 consensus. TreeHouse blames the weakness on reduced food purchases, warm weather, and (perhaps most intriguingly) a shift in sales from traditional grocery chains to "alternate" retailers such as "club stores, limited assortment stores, and dollar stores."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Shares of Sears (SHLD +4.3%) climb on rumors that the embattled retailer will be taken private...

    Shares of Sears (SHLD +4.3%) climb on rumors that the embattled retailer will be taken private by Eddie Lampert.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 4 Comments
  • ZOLL

    Zoll Medical (ZOLL +5.8%) surges at the open following strong FQ1 results which showed revenue...

    Zoll Medical (ZOLL +5.8%) surges at the open following strong FQ1 results which showed revenue from its LifeVest wearable defibrillator worn by patients at risk for sudden cardiac arrest, jumped 45% to $32.3M and now accounts for 20% of revenue. Zoll seems back on track after the strong quarter and Medicare's recent reversal of a decision to change its coverage policy.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -7.5%) is selling off post-earnings. While Q4 results beat estimates,...

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -7.5%) is selling off post-earnings. While Q4 results beat estimates, and 2012 revenue growth guidance of 17%-19% (issued during Intuitive's earnings call) is above a 16.5% consensus, the fact Intuitive sported a post-earnings trailing P/E of 39 suggests investors may have been looking for stronger growth. Cautious comments about European demand could also be having an effect.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • AONEQ

    Shares of A123 (AONE -6.1%) slide after the battery maker says it will sell 12.5M units...

    Shares of A123 (AONE -6.1%) slide after the battery maker says it will sell 12.5M units consisting of a share and a warrant for $2.034 per unit. The firm expects to net $23.5M from the sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • COF

    Capital One's (NYSE:COF) Q4 results "missed on every line item,” Nomura says. "Operating...

    Capital One's (NYSE:COF) Q4 results "missed on every line item,” Nomura says. "Operating expenses were a big miss that drives negative estimate revisions," so the firm cuts its 2012 EPS estimate to $5.50 from $6.00, and 2013 EPS to $6.50 from $7.00. It sticks with its Buy rating, as "core revenues were actually good" and valuation looks “really attractive” based on 2013 estimates. COF -6.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • INSM

    Premarket gainers: INSM +24%. ASIA +16%. SWKS +6%. URRE +6%. MPC +5%. BCS +4%. CTIC +4%. RBS...

    Premarket gainers: INSM +24%. ASIA +16%. SWKS +6%. URRE +6%. MPC +5%. BCS +4%. CTIC +4%. RBS +3%. IBM +3%. SAVE +3%. MSFT +3%.
    Losers: ALTH -20%. GOOG -8%. AONE -7%. SQNM -6%. HTGC -6%. COF -6%. PH -5%. ZIOP -5%. MMLP -5%. BWP -4%. CX -4%. CUK -4%. ARCC -4%. CCL -3%. NVS -3%. MT -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • DRL

    Doral Financial (NYSE:DRL) turns to a profit in Q4, as it records an earnings beat on the...

    Doral Financial (NYSE:DRL) turns to a profit in Q4, as it records an earnings beat on the strength of improved net interest margins and a reduced total of non-performing assets. Shares are rallying off the news, up 11.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • INSM

    Insmed (NASDAQ:INSM) +26.3% after announcing the FDA has lifted the clinical hold previously...

    Insmed (NASDAQ:INSM) +26.3% after announcing the FDA has lifted the clinical hold previously placed on the company's Arikace drug for treating lung infections. The company says it continues discussions with the FDA on the remaining hold on the drug in the treatment of cystic fibrosis patients.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • ALTH

    Allos Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ALTH) -19.3% premarket after receiving a negative opinion from...

    Allos Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ALTH) -19.3% premarket after receiving a negative opinion from European regulators on its Folotyn treatment for patients with peripheral T-cell lymphoma. The company says it plans to submit a request for re-examination of the opinion within two weeks.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • KGC

    Kinross Gold (NYSE:KGC) +1.5% premarket on speculation it may be a takeover target after saying...

    Kinross Gold (NYSE:KGC) +1.5% premarket on speculation it may be a takeover target after saying earlier this week it will write down the value of its Tasiast mine in Mauritania, sending shares tumbling 20%. The company sells for $0.76 per dollar of net assets vs. the industry median of 2.5x, according to Bloomberg. Newmont Mining (NYSE:NEM) is listed as a potentially interested suitor.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • ASIA

    AsiaInfo-Linkage (NASDAQ:ASIA) +19.4% premarket after announcing receipt of a going-private...

    AsiaInfo-Linkage (NASDAQ:ASIA) +19.4% premarket after announcing receipt of a going-private proposal from a subsidiary of CITIC Capital China Partners to acquire all ASIA outstanding common shares "at a price which represents a premium over the current stock price."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • BWP

    Shares of Boardwalk Pipeline Partners (NYSE:BWP) move 4.1% lower in premarket trading after the...

    Shares of Boardwalk Pipeline Partners (NYSE:BWP) move 4.1% lower in premarket trading after the firm announces an offering of 8M common units with an option for underwriters to sell an additional 1.2M common units.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM
  • PH

    Parker-Hannifin (NYSE:PH): FQ2 EPS of $1.56 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $3.10B (+8.4% Y/Y) beats...

    Parker-Hannifin (NYSE:PH): FQ2 EPS of $1.56 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $3.10B (+8.4% Y/Y) beats by $20M. Shares -4.67% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 AM
  • PG

    Morgan Stanley downgrades Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) to Equal-weight from Overweight after...

    Morgan Stanley downgrades Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) to Equal-weight from Overweight after shares hit a 52-week high and close in on the firm's previous price target of $68. Analysts call out the downside potential for 2012 earnings with their view that H2 guidance and the Street consensus are too high. Shares -0.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 AM
  • CLD

    S&P announces that Cloud Peak Energy (NYSE:CLD) will replace Tekelec (NASDAQ:TKLC) in the S&P...

    S&P announces that Cloud Peak Energy (NYSE:CLD) will replace Tekelec (NASDAQ:TKLC) in the S&P SmallCap 600 Index after the close of trading on Jan. 26. Shares of CLD +2.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 AM
  • NVS

    Europe's medical regulator says it has started a review of Novartis' (NYSE:NVS) MS drug Gilenya...

    Europe's medical regulator says it has started a review of Novartis' (NYSE:NVS) MS drug Gilenya after reports of heart problems in patients taking the drug. Gilenya has been authorized in Europe since March 2011, but this isn't the first setback for the drug. NVS -1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 AM
  • VOD

    Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD) wins its case in India's top court, and isn't liable for up to $4.4B in...

    Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD) wins its case in India's top court, and isn't liable for up to $4.4B in back-taxes and penalties. This is exceedingly good news both for Vodafone and for other firms fighting similar tax cases in India, including GE (NYSE:GE), SABMiller (OTCPK:SBMRF), Cadbury (KFT), AT&T (NYSE:T) and Sanofi-Aventis (NASDAQ:SNY). Vodafone +1.8% in London.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 AM
